meanings.definition: An award or privilege granted as a special honor or as an acknowledgment of merit.
meanings.sent1: Receiving an accolade for her hard work made her feel proud.
meanings.sent2: The actor was thrilled to receive the accolade for Best Performance.
meanings.sent3: The accolade for the fastest eater at the party went to Tom, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her promotion to team leader was the accolade she had been working towards.
meanings.sent5: Winning the spelling bee was the accolade that boosted his confidence.

meanings.definition: A touch on a person's shoulders with a sword at the bestowing of a knighthood.
meanings.sent1: The knight felt the weight of the accolade on his shoulders.
meanings.sent2: During the ceremony, the queen bestowed the accolade upon the new knight.
meanings.sent3: The accolade ceremony turned into a playful sword fight among the knights.
meanings.sent4: The accolade of knighthood transformed him into a respected figure in the kingdom.
meanings.sent5: The accolade of becoming a knight marked the beginning of his noble journey.
